H0.text: June 7 is the approximate date when the next full Moon will be observed in Buffalo, New York, following the full Moon observed there on June 1.

H1.text: June 15 is approximately when the next full Moon will be observed in Buffalo, New York, following the full Moon observed on June 1.

H2.text: July 1 is the approximate date when the next full Moon will be observed in Buffalo, New York after the full Moon observed on June 1.

H3.text: July 7 is the date when the next full Moon will be observed in Buffalo, New York, following the full Moon on June 1.

A5.text: The duration from full moon to new moon (or new moon to full moon) varies from approximately 13 days 22+1⁄2 hours to about 15 days 14+1⁄2 hours.

A6.text: A lunar month is the time between successive recurrences of the same phase: due to the eccentricity of the Moon's orbit, this duration is not perfectly constant but averages about 29.5 days.

A7.text: The mean length of a synodic month is 29.53059 days.

A8.text: The average period the Moon takes to cycle through its phases (new, first quarter, full, last quarter) and back again is 29–30 days.

A9.text: The actual time between lunations may vary from about 29.274 days to about 29.829 days.
